title: Drum of earthquake
data:
| ( [![Drum.png](/images/f/fb/Drum.png)](/wiki/File:Drum.png) |                                    |
| ----------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------- |
| Name                                                        | drum of earthquake                 |
| Appearance                                                  | [drum](/wiki/Drum "Drum")          |
| Base price                                                  | 25 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")   |
| Weight                                                      | [25](/wiki/Weight "Weight")        |
| Material                                                    | [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather") |
| Monster use                                                 | *Will not be used by monsters.*    |

The **drum of earthquake** is a type of [musical instrument](/wiki/Musical_instrument "Musical instrument") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [magical](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item") [atonal instrument](/wiki/Atonal_instrument "Atonal instrument") that is made of [leather](/wiki/Leather "Leather"), and appears as a [drum](/wiki/Drum "Drum") when unidentified.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [6.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

A drum of earthquake is generated with 4-8 charges.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

......................  
888888888888888888888\.  
888888888888888888888\.  
555555555555555555588\.  
555555555555555555588\.  
222222222222222225588\.  
222222222222222225588\.  
999999999999999225588\.  
999999999999999225588\.  
666666666666699225588\.  
666666666666699225588\.  
333333333336699225588\.  
333333333336699225588\.  
000000000336699225588\.  
000000000336699225588\.  
777777700336699225588\.  
777777700336699225588\.  
444447700336699225588\.  
444447700336699225588\.  
111447700336699225588\.  
111447700336699225588\.  
@11447700336699225588.

Size of pits and anger area.

Numbers: minimum experience level to affect that spot.

Red: 1-9, blue 10-19, green 20-29

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a charged drum of earthquake will create several [pits](/wiki/Pit "Pit") around and possibly under you, wake up and unfreeze all [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") on the level, and shake loose monsters [hiding](/wiki/Hiding "Hiding") on the ceiling[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) 447}} - this will also destroy dungeon features such as [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar"), [fountains](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain") and [thrones](/wiki/Throne "Throne"), and the range of its effects increases with your experience level.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) Monsters within 23.7 Euclidean distance will [flee](/wiki/Flee "Flee") if they don't [resist](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance"), and [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") monsters within a 4\*((u.ulevel - 1) / 3 + 1)+1 wide square centered on you will become hostile. The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") and other "meditating" monsters will only be awakened in that square area.

Applying a drum of earthquake with no charges has the same effects as a [leather drum](/wiki/Leather_drum "Leather drum"), though it will not render you [deaf](/wiki/Deaf "Deaf").

The pits created by a drum of earthquake can destroy [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar") similar to [applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging"), and works even on [undiggable](/wiki/Undiggable "Undiggable") dungeon levels. The high altars in [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum") and the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") are always unaffected.

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Leather drum](/wiki/Leather_drum "Leather drum")*

The drum of earthquake's random number and distribution of created pits makes it completely unreliable for opening a pit on a specific square. Be very careful using an unidentified drum on levels with peaceful monsters you don't want to provoke - in particular, creating an earthquake in [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown"), on the [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") home level, or anywhere with a [temple](/wiki/Temple "Temple") (especially co-aligned) is a very [bad idea](/wiki/Bad_idea "Bad idea").

For scenarios where you *do* want to wake up monsters, [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") in particular can attract the attention of their [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis"), the [Master Assassin](/wiki/Master_Assassin "Master Assassin"), by applying the drum while standing at the bottom right square of the left section of the [goal level](/wiki/Rogue_quest#Goal_level "Rogue quest") - the earthquake effect will wake him up immediately. The drum also has a niche application with [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") or [flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying"), where it can be used while doing either to slow down pursuing monsters.

In the late game and end game, the drum of earthquake is likely the best means of awakening the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") without having to climb the [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower"). It can also be somewhat useful to immobilize most non-flying monsters on a level, such as the aligned priests and player monsters on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane").

The same strategies for a leather drum apply to a drum of earthquake with no charges. Additionally, a spare drum of earthquake is suitable polyfodder as a magical tool and especially so for [pacifist](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"), since opening pits under monsters can kill them and break the conduct.

## History

The drum of earthquake first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Messages

- You produce a heavy, thunderous rolling!

  You applied a charged drum of earthquake.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the drum of earthquake can be used to wake up [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler") and obtain the [Candelabrum of Invocation](/wiki/Candelabrum_of_Invocation "Candelabrum of Invocation") without obtaining the [alignment keys](/wiki/Alignment_key "Alignment key") beforehand.

### dNetHack

In dNetHack, [Troubadours](/wiki/Troubadour "Troubadour") start the game with knowledge of the drum of earthquake, and [The Singing Sword](/wiki/The_Singing_Sword "The Singing Sword") can learn an earthshaking chant if a drum of earthquake is applied while it is wielded.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite"), a drum of earthquake can be created at a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace") by combining a leather drum and a [scroll of earth](/wiki/Scroll_of_earth "Scroll of earth").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), Bards start the game with knowledge of the drum of earthquake as in dNetHack, and [Musicians](/wiki/Musician "Musician") will start the game with an uncursed drum of earthquake.

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for leather drum](/wiki/Leather_drum#Encyclopedia_entry "Leather drum").*

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 962](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L962)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 241](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L241)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 641](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L641)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/music.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 650](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/music.c#L650)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Drum of earthquake

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
(
Name drum of earthquake
Appearance drum
Base price 25 zm
Weight 25
Material leather
Monster use Will not be used by monsters.

The drum of earthquake is a type of musical instrument that appears in NetHack. It is a magical atonal instrument that is made of leather, and appears as a drum when unidentified.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Messages
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 dNetHack
    • 6.3 SpliceHack
    • 6.4 SlashTHEM
  • 7 Encyclopedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

A drum of earthquake is generated with 4-8 charges.[1]

Description

......................
888888888888888888888.
888888888888888888888.
555555555555555555588.
555555555555555555588.
222222222222222225588.
222222222222222225588.
999999999999999225588.
999999999999999225588.
666666666666699225588.
666666666666699225588.
333333333336699225588.
333333333336699225588.
000000000336699225588.
000000000336699225588.
777777700336699225588.
777777700336699225588.
444447700336699225588.
444447700336699225588.
111447700336699225588.
111447700336699225588.
@11447700336699225588.
Size of pits and anger area.

Numbers: minimum experience level to affect that spot.

Red: 1-9, blue 10-19, green 20-29

Applying a charged drum of earthquake will create several pits around and possibly under you, wake up and unfreeze all monsters on the level, and shake loose monsters hiding on the ceiling[2][3] 447}} - this will also destroy dungeon features such as altars, fountains and thrones, and the range of its effects increases with your experience level.[4] Monsters within 23.7 Euclidean distance will flee if they don't resist, and peaceful monsters within a 4*((u.ulevel - 1) / 3 + 1)+1 wide square centered on you will become hostile. The Wizard of Yendor and other "meditating" monsters will only be awakened in that square area.

Applying a drum of earthquake with no charges has the same effects as a leather drum, though it will not render you deaf.

The pits created by a drum of earthquake can destroy altars similar to applying a wand of digging, and works even on undiggable dungeon levels. The high altars in Moloch's Sanctum and the Astral Plane are always unaffected.

Strategy

Main article: Leather drum

The drum of earthquake's random number and distribution of created pits makes it completely unreliable for opening a pit on a specific square. Be very careful using an unidentified drum on levels with peaceful monsters you don't want to provoke - in particular, creating an earthquake in Minetown, on the quest home level, or anywhere with a temple (especially co-aligned) is a very bad idea.

For scenarios where you do want to wake up monsters, Rogues in particular can attract the attention of their quest nemesis, the Master Assassin, by applying the drum while standing at the bottom right square of the left section of the goal level - the earthquake effect will wake him up immediately. The drum also has a niche application with levitation or flying, where it can be used while doing either to slow down pursuing monsters.

In the late game and end game, the drum of earthquake is likely the best means of awakening the Wizard of Yendor without having to climb the Wizard's Tower. It can also be somewhat useful to immobilize most non-flying monsters on a level, such as the aligned priests and player monsters on the Astral Plane.

The same strategies for a leather drum apply to a drum of earthquake with no charges. Additionally, a spare drum of earthquake is suitable polyfodder as a magical tool and especially so for pacifist conduct, since opening pits under monsters can kill them and break the conduct.

History

The drum of earthquake first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Messages

You produce a heavy, thunderous rolling!
You applied a charged drum of earthquake.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the drum of earthquake can be used to wake up Vlad the Impaler and obtain the Candelabrum of Invocation without obtaining the alignment keys beforehand.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, Troubadours start the game with knowledge of the drum of earthquake, and The Singing Sword can learn an earthshaking chant if a drum of earthquake is applied while it is wielded.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack and SpliceHack-Rewrite, a drum of earthquake can be created at a furnace by combining a leather drum and a scroll of earth.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, Bards start the game with knowledge of the drum of earthquake as in dNetHack, and Musicians will start the game with an uncursed drum of earthquake.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for leather drum.

References

{{tool
  |color=leather color
  |tile=[[image:drum.png]]
  |name=drum of earthquake
  |appearance=[[drum]]

  |weight=25
  |material=leather
}}

The '''drum of earthquake''' is a type of [[musical instrument]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a [[Magical item|magical]] [[atonal instrument]] that is made of [[leather]], and appears as a [[drum]] when unidentified.

==Generation==
A drum of earthquake is generated with 4-8 charges.{{refsrc|src/mkobj.c|962|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Description==
{{float right|{{caption|{{EarthquakeArea}}|Size of pits and anger area.
Numbers: minimum experience level to affect that spot.
Red: 1-9, blue 10-19, green 20-29}}}}
[[Apply]]ing a charged drum of earthquake will create several [[pit]]s around and possibly under you, wake up and unfreeze all [[monster]]s on the level, and shake loose monsters [[hiding]] on the ceiling{{refsrc|src/music.c|241|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/music.c|641|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} 447}} - this will also destroy dungeon features such as [[altar]]s, [[fountain]]s and [[throne]]s, and the range of its effects increases with your experience level.{{refsrc|src/music.c|650|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Monsters within 23.7 Euclidean distance will [[flee]] if they don't [[monster magic resistance|resist]], and [[peaceful]] monsters within a 4*((u.ulevel - 1) / 3 + 1)+1 wide square centered on you will become hostile. The [[Wizard of Yendor]] and other "meditating" monsters will only be awakened in that square area.

Applying a drum of earthquake with no charges has the same effects as a [[leather drum]], though it will not render you [[deaf]].

The pits created by a drum of earthquake can destroy [[altar]]s similar to [[apply]]ing a [[wand of digging]], and works even on [[undiggable]] dungeon levels. The high altars in [[Moloch's Sanctum]] and the [[Astral Plane]] are always unaffected.

==Strategy==
{{main|Leather drum}}
The drum of earthquake's random number and distribution of created pits makes it completely unreliable for opening a pit on a specific square. Be very careful using an unidentified drum on levels with peaceful monsters you don't want to provoke - in particular, creating an earthquake in [[Minetown]], on the [[quest]] home level, or anywhere with a [[temple]] (especially co-aligned) is a very [[bad idea]].

For scenarios where you ''do'' want to wake up monsters, [[Rogue]]s in particular can attract the attention of their [[quest nemesis]], the [[Master Assassin]], by applying the drum while standing at the bottom right square of the left section of the [[Rogue quest#Goal level|goal level]] - the earthquake effect will wake him up immediately. The drum also has a niche application with [[levitation]] or [[flying]], where it can be used while doing either to slow down pursuing monsters.

In the late game and end game, the drum of earthquake is likely the best means of awakening the [[Wizard of Yendor]] without having to climb the [[Wizard's Tower]]. It can also be somewhat useful to immobilize most non-flying monsters on a level, such as the aligned priests and player monsters on the [[Astral Plane]].

The same strategies for a leather drum apply to a drum of earthquake with no charges. Additionally, a spare drum of earthquake is suitable polyfodder as a magical tool and especially so for [[pacifist]] [[conduct]], since opening pits under monsters can kill them and break the conduct.

==History==
The drum of earthquake first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Messages==
{{message|You produce a heavy, thunderous rolling!|You applied a charged drum of earthquake.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], the drum of earthquake can be used to wake up [[Vlad the Impaler]] and obtain the [[Candelabrum of Invocation]] without obtaining the [[alignment key]]s beforehand.

===dNetHack===
In dNetHack, [[Troubadour]]s start the game with knowledge of the drum of earthquake, and [[The Singing Sword]] can learn an earthshaking chant if a drum of earthquake is applied while it is wielded.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]] and [[SpliceHack-Rewrite]], a drum of earthquake can be created at a [[furnace]] by combining a leather drum and a [[scroll of earth]].

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], Bards start the game with knowledge of the drum of earthquake as in dNetHack, and [[Musician]]s will start the game with an uncursed drum of earthquake.

==Encyclopedia entry==
